title: Getting Started with GeoLightViz
text: first step load geolocator data using tag_create() function GeoPressureR package. function reads raw light measurements structures standardized format. Key parameters: crop_start crop_end: Define analysis period, excluding irrelevant data deployment retrieval assert_pressure = FALSE: Required light-geolocators without atmospheric pressure sensors resulting tag object contains: Light data: Cropped specified date range Twilight events: Automatically detected sunrise sunset times
code: tag <- tag_create(   "14OI",   directory = file.path(extdata_dir, "data/raw-tag/14OI"),   crop_start = "2015-08-09",   crop_end = "2016-07-11",   assert_pressure = FALSE )  # Detect twilight events tag <- twilight_create(tag)  # View the tag structure tag

title: Getting Started with GeoLightViz
text: Twilight times detected light measurements can noisy due weather conditions, shading, sensor issues. main twilight plot provides tool help identify exclude problematic data points. label: Click ‚ÄúStart labeling‚Äù toolbar Single points: Click individual twilight markers toggle status Batch selection: Draw rectangle select multiple points

title: Getting Started with GeoLightViz
text: Stationary periods time intervals bird remained fixed location. create staps: Click ‚Äú+‚Äù icon toolbar enable drawing mode Draw rectangle light plot define time range Look patterns: Parallel, smooth twilight lines indicate stable latitude (stationary behavior)

title: Getting Started with GeoLightViz
text: can export twilight label (typically stored data/twilight-label/14OI-labeled.csv) staps (typically stored data/staps/14OI.csv). files used Step 2 spatial analysis.

what: Lauching the app with Likelihood Maps
title: Getting Started with GeoLightViz
text: Using twilight labels known locations, GeoLightViz generates likelihood maps showing probable bird positions based day length patterns.

previous_headings: Lauching the app with Likelihood Maps
what: Loading the twilight labels and known locations
title: Getting Started with GeoLightViz
text: First, load twilight labels: Next, load stationary periods add GPS coordinates known locations Finally, define geographic extent resolution likelihood map calculations (See GeoPressureR:::tag_set_map() details): Launching Enhanced Application map configuration complete, GeoLightViz now provides additional powerful features: map panel now displays: - Likelihood surfaces: Color-coded probability maps based day length matching - Position markers: Geographic locations stationary period - Interactive exploration: Click positions map see corresponding twilight patterns Manual adjustment: Click map test different position hypotheses Twilight comparison: Observe predicted twilight times (lines) match observed data (points) Maximum likelihood: Use ‚ÄúML‚Äù button automatically find probable position Compare twilight distributions calibrated stationary periods (known coordinates) uncalibrated periods Evaluate quality: Assess well sun elevation angle calibration performs across different time periods Visualize uncertainty: Use histogram view examine twilight error distributions
code: tag <- twilight_label_read(   tag,   file = file.path(extdata_dir, "data/twilight-label/14OI-labeled.csv") ) tag$stap <- read.csv(file.path(extdata_dir, "data/staps/14OI.csv")) |>   mutate(     known_lon = 11.93128,     known_lat = 51.3629   ) tag$param$tag_set_map <- list(   extent = c(-5, 25, -10, 55),   scale = 5 ) geolightviz(tag)

what: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis
title: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis
text: GeoLightViz R package provides interactive Shiny application visualizing analyzing light-level geolocator data. app helps researchers explore complete workflow raw light measurements geographic positions.

title: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis
text: üîç Side--side twilight‚Äìmap visualization: Instantly see sunrise/sunset times translate geographic positions ‚úèÔ∏è Interactive labeling: Interactively discard twilight points watch position estimates update real time üìç Stationary period explorer: Define periods bird can assumed location estimate likely locations üéØ Real-time position updates: Change position map preview expected twilight patterns location üìä Calibration comparison: Visualize error distributions assess calibration assumptions impact known locations üó∫Ô∏è Likelihood exploration: Explore probability surfaces position uncertainty üíæ Workflow support: Export labeled data integration GeoPressureR‚Äôs advanced modeling tools ‚ö° Learn : intuitive interface makes twilight geolocation methods transparent accessible

title: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis
text: can install development version GeoLightViz :

title: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis
text: package includes example data European Bee-eater tagged Germany. Try : ‚Äôs ! app open browser can: üìñ detailed step--step tutorial examples, see See complete workflow tutorial ‚Üí
code: # Get example data path extdata_dir <- system.file("extdata", package = "GeoLightViz")  # Load and launch tag <- tag_create(   "14OI",   directory = file.path(extdata_dir, "data/raw-tag/14OI"),   crop_start = "2015-08-09",   crop_end = "2016-07-11",   assert_pressure = FALSE )  geolightviz(tag)

title: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis
text: use GeoLightViz research, please cite:

title: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis

what: GeoLightViz: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis ‚Äî GeoLightViz-package
title: GeoLightViz: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis ‚Äî GeoLightViz-package
text: Provides interactive Shiny application exploring understanding light-level geolocator data analysis. app features unique side--side visualization shows twilight events (sunrise/sunset times) translate geographic positions map real-time. Users can interactively label twilight data, define stationary periods, test position hypotheses clicking map, explore calibration effects likelihood surfaces. Designed make complex twilight geolocation method transparent intuitive, helping researchers understand data quality, position uncertainty, role calibration improving estimates.

title: GeoLightViz: Interactive Visualization Tool for Light-Level Geolocator Analysis ‚Äî GeoLightViz-package
text: Maintainer: Rapha√´l Nussbaumer rafnuss@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Start the GeoLightViz shiny app ‚Äî geolightviz
title: Start the GeoLightViz shiny app ‚Äî geolightviz
text: Start GeoLightViz shiny app

title: Start the GeoLightViz shiny app ‚Äî geolightviz
code: geolightviz(x, path = NULL, launch_browser = TRUE, run_bg = TRUE)

title: Start the GeoLightViz shiny app ‚Äî geolightviz
text: x GeoPressureR tag object, .Rdata file unique identifier id .Rdata file located "./data/interim/{id}.RData". path GeoPressureR path pressurepath data.frame. launch_browser true (default), app runs browser, otherwise runs Rstudio. run_bg true (default), app runs background R process using callr::r_bg(), allowing continue using R console. false, app blocks console closed.
